title: NET Team Lead & Solution Architect Quiz
description: A practice test with multiple-choice and true/false questions covering .NET leadership, architecture, cloud, design patterns, DevOps, SharePoint, Power Platform and enterprise engineering

questions.text: Which SPFx base class controls lifecycle of a client-side web part?
questions.explanation: This base class manages initialization, rendering and disposal.

questions.text: Which protocol is used by gRPC for high-performance RPC communication?
questions.explanation: gRPC uses HTTP/2 and Protocol Buffers for compact, fast communication.

questions.text: What is the command to create a new ASP.NET Core Web API project?
questions.explanation: dotnet new webapi scaffolds a Web API project.

questions.text: Which logging abstraction is built into ASP.NET Core?
questions.explanation: ILogger is the built-in logging abstraction in ASP.NET Core.

questions.text: Which Azure service is most commonly used for hosting containerized .NET microservices?
questions.explanation: AKS is the managed Kubernetes service for containers.

questions.text: Which HTTP method should be used when updating a resource partially?
questions.explanation: PATCH is used for partial updates; PUT replaces the resource.

questions.text: Which approach reduces downtime by switching traffic between two identical environments?
questions.explanation: Blue-Green switches traffic between two environments to minimize downtime.

questions.text: Which authentication flow is recommended for server-to-server (daemon) apps in Azure AD?
questions.explanation: Client Credentials flow allows app-only authentication without user interaction.

questions.text: Which monitoring technique captures end-to-end request flow across services?
questions.explanation: Distributed tracing provides visibility across microservice calls.

questions.text: Which DevOps practice aims to keep codebase always in a releasable state by integrating changes frequently?
questions.explanation: CI runs automated builds and tests on integrated code changes.

questions.text: Which Azure service provides serverless event-driven compute for short-running tasks?
questions.explanation: Functions provide serverless compute triggered by events.

questions.text: Which EF Core feature helps reduce round trips by retrieving related entities in a single query?
questions.explanation: Eager loading fetches related data in the initial query.

questions.text: Which tool is used to perform static code analysis and track code quality?
questions.explanation: SonarQube analyzes code quality and identifies issues.

questions.text: Which message delivery semantic attempts to guarantee a message is processed only once?
questions.explanation: Exactly-once semantics ensure single processing of a message.

questions.text: Which pattern separates read and write models to improve scalability?
questions.explanation: CQRS separates read and write models for scalability and optimization.

questions.text: Which pattern helps manage failures by opening a circuit after repeated errors?
questions.explanation: Circuit breaker prevents cascading failures by halting calls to a failing service.

questions.text: Which .NET runtime is cross-platform and optimized for high-performance server applications?
questions.explanation: .NET Core (now .NET) is the cross-platform runtime for high-performance apps.

questions.text: Which Azure service provides distributed messaging with pub/sub semantics?
questions.explanation: Service Bus Topics implement pub/sub messaging patterns.

questions.text: Which SharePoint feature centralizes navigation across related sites?
questions.explanation: Hub sites provide shared navigation and search across associated sites.

questions.text: Which Azure component provides identity and access management for apps?
questions.explanation: Azure Active Directory manages identities, apps and auth.

questions.text: Which Azure service is used for secrets, keys and certificate management?
questions.explanation: Key Vault securely stores secrets, keys and certificates.

questions.text: Which Azure service accelerates global content delivery via edge POPs?
questions.explanation: Azure CDN caches content at edge locations for fast delivery.

questions.text: Which component in ASP.NET Core processes requests via a configured pipeline?
questions.explanation: Middleware composes the request pipeline.

questions.text: Which caching approach is best for storing session data in a distributed system?
questions.explanation: Distributed caches like Redis allow sharing cached data across multiple instances.

questions.text: What design pattern is commonly used to decouple an interface from its implementation?
questions.explanation: Dependency Injection supplies dependencies externally, improving testability.

questions.text: Which provisioning engine is commonly used to automate modern SharePoint site provisioning?
questions.explanation: PnP provisioning automates site templates and artifacts.

questions.text: Which storage is optimized for large binary files in Azure?
questions.explanation: Blob Storage is designed for unstructured binary data.

questions.text: Which design principle stands for Open/Closed, Liskov, etc.?
questions.explanation: SOLID is a set of object-oriented design principles.

questions.text: Which architectural style encourages splitting systems into independently deployable services?
questions.explanation: Microservices promote independent deployment and scaling.

questions.text: Which .NET collection provides O(1) average lookup by key?
questions.explanation: Dictionary provides average O(1) key-based lookups.

questions.text: Which Azure database is recommended for globally distributed, multi-region applications?
questions.explanation: Cosmos DB provides planet-scale distribution and low latency.

questions.text: Which Azure database offers multi-master writes and multiple consistency levels?
questions.explanation: Cosmos DB supports multi-master and configurable consistency.

questions.text: Which SharePoint feature centralizes navigation across related sites?
questions.explanation: Hub sites provide shared navigation and search across associated sites.

questions.text: Which protocol is used by gRPC for high-performance RPC communication?
questions.explanation: gRPC uses HTTP/2 and Protocol Buffers for compact, fast communication.

questions.text: Which component in ASP.NET Core processes requests via a configured pipeline?
questions.explanation: Middleware composes the request pipeline.

questions.text: Which tool is used to perform static code analysis and track code quality?
questions.explanation: SonarQube analyzes code quality and identifies issues.

questions.text: Which architectural style encourages splitting systems into independently deployable services?
questions.explanation: Microservices promote independent deployment and scaling.

questions.text: Which component in ASP.NET Core processes requests via a configured pipeline?
questions.explanation: Middleware composes the request pipeline.

questions.text: What design pattern is commonly used to decouple an interface from its implementation?
questions.explanation: Dependency Injection supplies dependencies externally, improving testability.

questions.text: Which logging abstraction is built into ASP.NET Core?
questions.explanation: ILogger is the built-in logging abstraction in ASP.NET Core.

questions.text: Unit tests should not access real databases.
questions.explanation: Unit tests should isolate code and use mocks; database access belongs in integration tests.

questions.text: SPFx web parts can run on classic SharePoint pages.
questions.explanation: SPFx supports both modern and classic pages in many scenarios.

questions.text: Async/await improves throughput by increasing CPU utilization.
questions.explanation: Async/await improves scalability by freeing threads for I/O-bound work, not by increasing CPU usage.

questions.text: Power Automate cannot update SharePoint document metadata.
questions.explanation: Power Automate can update item and file metadata via connectors.

questions.text: Entity Framework Core supports both LINQ and raw SQL queries.
questions.explanation: EF Core supports LINQ queries and raw SQL via FromSql methods.

questions.text: gRPC is generally faster than REST for internal service communication.
questions.explanation: gRPC is binary and uses HTTP/2, often giving better performance for internal RPC.

questions.text: Azure Functions can be triggered by a SharePoint Webhook.
questions.explanation: SharePoint webhooks can notify HTTP endpoints such as Functions.

questions.text: Structs in C# are reference types.
questions.explanation: Structs are value types in C#.

questions.text: Modern SharePoint promotes flat site architecture over deep subsite structures.
questions.explanation: Modern SPO guidance recommends a flat architecture with hub sites.

questions.text: JWT tokens must always be stored in local storage for security.
questions.explanation: Local storage is vulnerable to XSS; more secure options include HTTP-only cookies.

questions.text: What is the command to create a new ASP.NET Core Web API project?
questions.explanation: dotnet new webapi scaffolds a Web API project.

questions.text: Structs in C# are reference types.
questions.explanation: Structs are value types in C#.

questions.text: SharePoint Online supports full trust farm solutions.
questions.explanation: Full-trust farm solutions are not supported in SharePoint Online.

questions.text: Azure Functions can be triggered by a SharePoint Webhook.
questions.explanation: SharePoint webhooks can notify HTTP endpoints such as Functions.

questions.text: Power Apps Canvas apps can only connect to Microsoft 365 services.
questions.explanation: Canvas apps support many connectors including SQL, Dataverse, Salesforce and others.

questions.text: gRPC is generally faster than REST for internal service communication.
questions.explanation: gRPC is binary and uses HTTP/2, often giving better performance for internal RPC.

questions.text: Azure Service Bus is used for real-time streaming analytics.
questions.explanation: Azure Event Hubs is designed for streaming analytics; Service Bus is messaging.

questions.text: ASP.NET Core middleware executes in a pipeline sequentially.
questions.explanation: Middleware executes in the order it's registered and can short-circuit.

questions.text: Power Automate cannot update SharePoint document metadata.
questions.explanation: Power Automate can update item and file metadata via connectors.

questions.text: Clean Architecture enforces separation of concerns through concentric layers.
questions.explanation: Clean Architecture separates concerns into layers and enforces dependency rules.

questions.text: A .NET solution architect should prioritize coupling over cohesion.
questions.explanation: Good architecture favors low coupling and high cohesion.
